basicInformation.occupation: Delivery driver (on feet most of the day)

chiefComplaintAndPresentIllness.primaryComplaint: Right knee pain despite less severe radiographic findings
chiefComplaintAndPresentIllness.symptoms: Aching pain after walking, difficulty with stairs, occasional locking/catching
chiefComplaintAndPresentIllness.painCharacteristics: Mild pain with walking and standing, moderate pain with stairs
chiefComplaintAndPresentIllness.functionalLimitations: Avoids kneeling, squatting, jumping, and pivoting

rangeOfMotion.rightKnee: Flexion 105°, Extension lag of 6° (cannot fully extend)

pastMedicalHistory: Right knee injury 15 years ago (twisted playing soccer, never properly evaluated)
Hypertension diagnosed 5 years ago, controlled with medication
familyHistory: Father had knee problems in his 60s

medications: Ibuprofen 400mg PRN for knee pain (3-4 times weekly)
physicalTherapy: No previous physical therapy or rehabilitation
Tried over-the-counter knee brace without significant benefit

currentPsychologicalStatus: Frustrated and worried about knee condition
Concerned about potential impact on employment
treatmentGoals: Reduce pain to maintain current employment
treatmentPreferences: Prefers to avoid surgery if possible
Willing to consider most non-surgical interventions
availableResources: Coverage for specialist visits and physical therapy with small copay
Lives near major medical center with good access to care
Can commit to 20-30 minutes of daily home exercises
Schedule allows for weekly therapy appointments
